publicationStmt.p: Produced at the Digital Scholarship Center at Temple University (Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, US) as part of the Project "Encyclopedic Time." This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

sourceDesc.bibl: The Encyclopaedia Britannica: A Dictionary of Arts, Sciences, Literature and General Information. 11th ed. NY: Encyclopaedia Britannica Company, 1911.

encodingDesc.p: Text derived from original OCR by the Digital Scholarship Center, Temple University, produced with Abby FineReader 12. Source images were created by California Digital Archive, and uploaded to the Internet Archive, JP2 format. Basic e-Learning Library (BeLL), archived in the Internet Archive, JP2 format. Print source was the Encyclopaedia Britannica, 9th ed., 25 vols. (NY: Charles Scribner's Sons, 1875-1889) in the collection of the University of California Library, Berkeley, CA.

projectDesc.p: These texts are generated for the use of the Encyclopedia Project at Temple University, which is conducting research into the language of knowledge in the nineteenth century.
